meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unchanging or constant.
meanings.sent1: The invariance of the laws of physics is crucial for scientific research.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians rely on the invariance of certain properties in their proofs.
meanings.sent3: The invariance of the recipe made it impossible to improve the taste.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was an invariance in a world of constant change.
meanings.sent5: The invariance of the North Star guided sailors through centuries of exploration.

meanings.definition: The property of remaining unchanged under a specified transformation or operation.
meanings.sent1: The invariance of the algorithm ensures accurate results every time.
meanings.sent2: The invariance of the encryption key is essential for data security.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had a surprising invariance to all his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an invariance that brightened even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: The invariance of the ancient artifact puzzled archaeologists for years.
